column4: had that problem today, seems to be due to mounting the wrong partition as home i used fdisk - l /dev/hdX to work out what the correct partitions were...the whole UUID system in fstab and grub hasn't worked well for me
wel I'm having even more problems .. apperantly windows corrupted one of my disks, linux thinks it's ntfs now (except fdisk which still sees it as Linux)
i would try installing gparted and see what it thinks of your partitions then modify fstab based on that
I have gparted, and it also says my partition is ntfs, but it gives some warning
so you have only one partition
just this one that windows ruined :S
how are you trying ot mount it
well, atm just with mount, but since gparted says it's ntfs maybe I should try something else
I'm making a screen of gparted and a paste of fdisk
is it ok if i try and pm you? this is moving a bit fast
haha, yeah you need to register
maybe try different server for pm?
you have gmail or something...if not ill try and help in here
